post.title: What crime(s), in your opinion, makes someone beyond redemption?

body: Animal cruelty.  When one is deliberately causes an animal pain for nothing other than some sick form of enjoyment, it makes me think that person is a deeply broken person.

post.title: What crime(s), in your opinion, makes someone beyond redemption?

author.bio:
Da pacem, Domine, in diebus nostris

Quia non est alius

Qui pugnet pro nobis

Nisi tu Deus noster.
author.bio_html:
Da pacem, Domine, in diebus nostris

Quia non est alius

Qui pugnet pro nobis

Nisi tu Deus noster.

body: Rape (man or woman), school shooters, pedophilia, and human trafficking (for the sex trade, slavery, organ harvesting, etc.) but because of my own beliefs and experiences, I cannot necessarily say their souls are entirely beyond redemption due to my beliefs and experiences, but it's a long way back for sure and there is a price to pay no matter what. What that price is depends on how much or how little they want to be forgiven & redeemed, especially when it comes to protecting others from their lusts and hunger.
body_html: Rape (man or woman), school shooters, pedophilia, and human trafficking (for the sex trade, slavery, organ harvesting, etc.) but because of my own beliefs and experiences, I cannot necessarily say their souls are entirely beyond redemption due to my beliefs and experiences, but it's a long way back for sure and there is a price to pay no matter what. What that price is depends on how much or how little they want to be forgiven & redeemed, especially when it comes to protecting others from their lusts and hunger.

post.title: What crime(s), in your opinion, makes someone beyond redemption?

body: Making a mildly off color joke on twitter five years ago. Especially if you were like 20 at the time, and you have demonstrably matured and changed your outlook since then. There's just no coming back from that.
body_html: Making a mildly off color joke on twitter five years ago. Especially if you were like 20 at the time, and you have demonstrably matured and changed your outlook since then. There's just no coming back from that.

parent.body: Murders that are pointless, in which the perpetrator had the option not to kill, but did it anyway, just 'cos'.  Chris Watts murdering his kids for example, I can't get my head around that.  No use to humanity, burn in hell fuckhead.

parent.body: Making a mildly off color joke on twitter five years ago. Especially if you were like 20 at the time, and you have demonstrably matured and changed your outlook since then. There's just no coming back from that.
parent.body_html: Making a mildly off color joke on twitter five years ago. Especially if you were like 20 at the time, and you have demonstrably matured and changed your outlook since then. There's just no coming back from that.

post.title: What crime(s), in your opinion, makes someone beyond redemption?

body: Murder I think can often be explained but the one crime I think we should fast-track express lane execution for is killing a cop. If you can murder the personal manifestation of societal law and order you respect nothing and should die.
body_html: Murder I think can often be explained but the one crime I think we should fast-track express lane execution for is killing a cop. If you can murder the personal manifestation of societal law and order you respect nothing and should die.

post.title: What crime(s), in your opinion, makes someone beyond redemption?

author.bio:
* *Greg*. | Haole originally from Hawaii. (Haole = "He without breath.", i.e. White Boy)
* Associates in InfoSec + Network Support | CompTIA A+, Network+, Security+
* Ruqqus Discord Jannie, IrreleventIdiot#8516
* PCMR | Patriot | Super Straight
author.bio_html:
• Greg. | Haole originally from Hawaii. (Haole = "He without breath.", i.e. White Boy)
  • Associates in InfoSec + Network Support | CompTIA A+, Network+, Security+
  • Ruqqus Discord Jannie, IrreleventIdiot#8516
  • PCMR | Patriot | Super Straight

body:
Jesus said that for any man who leads a child astray, it would be better for that man to have a milestone tied to his neck and hurled into the depths of the sea.

Pedos, Gays "who want to come for out Children", Child Molesters(not just pedos but child abusers), etc. at the very least should just be castrated.

Proven Rapists too.

As a Christian I think no-one beyond redemption, however that doesn't mean they shouldn't suffer worldly consequences.
body_html:
Jesus said that for any man who leads a child astray, it would be better for that man to have a milestone tied to his neck and hurled into the depths of the sea.

Pedos, Gays "who want to come for out Children", Child Molesters(not just pedos but child abusers), etc. at the very least should just be castrated.

Proven Rapists too.

As a Christian I think no-one beyond redemption, however that doesn't mean they shouldn't suffer worldly consequences.

body:
I understand your sentiment but if a piece of shit got to heaven you'd better believe he actually repented and felt crushing guilt for his actions all the way.

Otherwise it's probably Hellfire for him.

God is beyond worldly things, including sins and wrongs. It's hard, but one must remind one's self that our feelings and judgements are imperfect.
body_html:
I understand your sentiment but if a piece of shit got to heaven you'd better believe he actually repented and felt crushing guilt for his actions all the way.

Otherwise it's probably Hellfire for him.

God is beyond worldly things, including sins and wrongs. It's hard, but one must remind one's self that our feelings and judgements are imperfect.
